summary: The diff adds a new single-page marketing layout (header, hero, services, proof, testimonials, process, CTA, footer) with a Tailwind design system and sticky header/micro-interactions. However, some requested structure/content alignment and SEO/accessibility details are either missing or cannot be verified from the truncated diff, and a few added features (auth/actor hooks, backend stub, email capture behavior) are not requested by the build requirements.

missing_requirements.requirement: Primary pages/sections follow an SEO Sherpa-like structure while using AMS Digital Agency content/branding (including referenced navigation sections).
missing_requirements.reason: Navigation includes an "About" link to #about, but App.tsx does not render any About section/component, so that section structure appears incomplete/broken.

missing_requirements.requirement: SEO-friendly markup and accessibility baselines (e.g., headings logical hierarchy and stable, complete section anchors).
missing_requirements.reason: Footer includes links to #privacy, #terms, and #cookies, but no corresponding sections are present in the composed page, which can harm UX/SEO (dead anchors) and navigability.

hallucinated_features.description: Internet Identity authentication context and actor creation/invalidation logic via React Query hooks.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest is a marketing-site UI/UX revamp and explicitly lists auth-provider changes as a non-goal; adding auth/actor plumbing is not requested for the UI/UX revamp itself.

hallucinated_features.description: Backend canister stub added with an empty actor.
hallucinated_features.reason: No backend changes are required for the UI/UX revamp; adding a new backend main.mo is not requested and may be unrelated to the frontend styling goals.

hallucinated_features.description: Email capture form that logs submitted email to console plus marketing claims (e.g., money-back guarantee, free consultation).
hallucinated_features.reason: The request emphasized keeping AMS Digital Agency branding/content and not introducing unrelated product features; this adds lead-capture behavior and new promises that are not evidenced as part of the requested content migration.
